metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8628 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in PolarSSL before 1.2.12 and 1.3.x before 1.3.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a large number of crafted X.509 certificates.  NOTE: this identifier has been SPLIT per ADT3 due to different affected versions. See CVE-2014-9744 for the ClientHello message issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8628` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmbedcrypto1 - 1.3.9-2.1
libmbedtls10 - 1.3.9-2.1
libmbedx509-0 - 1.3.9-2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mbedtls package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.9-2.1').
